spanGrp.span: We, Urum people that are Christians live in this village.
biz bu kövdä yašierıh urumlar angısınärki biz khristian
We celebrate every Orthodox feast and we go to the church and light our candles.
biz äp khristianski praznikläri dutirıh giderıh mumumuzi yahirıh
The sacrifices we make they are from the Old Testament.
vetkhi zavettan ğalmıš bizä ğurbannar o išläri edirıh
There are other nationalities here that live with us and have other religion, they are Muslim.
bizınän genä burda var yašian millätlär religialari özgä musulmannar
We can’t go well with them.
We are faithful Orthodox people that have the right way.
biz pravaslavni inamli halh bizım yolumuz yol
They lead the Muslim life and we can’t understand each other just in that.
onnarın yol musulmanski bir o ištä birbirımızi ğanamerıh
Also we speak different language, Urum that is the Turkish dialect, which we consider as our language that is not similar to any other language.
bizım genä dilımız airi biz söilierıh türk dialektında urumja angısınidä biz saierıh bizım dil angisi ki eč bänzämer eč bir erdä
They speak Georgian language which adds some Turkish words that I don’t know.
onnar söilerlär gürjujä ğarıšıh turetski sözlär ğatierlär angisiki bän bülirım
Our cultures are different, we have different weddings and they also have different.
bizım kulturamız airidır bizım dügünnärımız airidır onnarın airidır
